cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 mi SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest toward the middle Texas coast, forecast to stall near or just inland of the coast and meander slowly northeastward toward the upper Texas coast/SW Louisiana through early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi–Port O'Connor, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield to Mouth of Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent TX; Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island TX; Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from the Rio Grande to High Island and extending eastward into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible (56% chance of ≥34 kt, 20% chance of ≥50 kt; hurricane-force risk very low at 3%) beginning late Saturday night or Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible for the stretch from Jamaica Beach to High Island, which includes the Port Arthur area, especially if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches of rain with isolated totals to 35 inches possible over the upper Texas coast leading to life-threatening freshwater flooding around Port Arthur.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and a slight tornado risk in outer rainbands.
